chapter.title: Using Designer to build a VDB

sect1.title: Download Designer
sect1.para: Federate Tools project provides a Eclipse based designer tool for this purpose of building a VDB. You can download Designer here Also, follow instructions for the tool as to how to install on your machine. Once done installing, start the Designer.

sect1.title: Building a VDB
sect1.para: Once you start the Designer, there are various steps you will need to do to create a VDB. The below is a list of steps that need to be accomplished using the Designer tool. See the video at the end of the list, that will takes you though the all the steps involved.

listitem.para: Switch to Designer Prespective, by opening the "Window->Open Prespective.."
Import the Derby database's "account" schema into a source model.
Manually create the source model for the "Text File". Create a Table called "Price" with "stock" and "price" as column names
In the "AccountView" model, create a virtual table (called as Base Table in the menu), and build the transformation query combining the "Accounts" tables with "Price" table
In the "AccountView" model, create a virtual procedure called "buyStock", to learn about procedure language.
Create a VDB based on the models created
Test the created VDB with some ad-hoc queries inside Designer.
Export or copy the VDB for use in your application.
